title: Data Strategy Consultant (m/f/d)
description:
At Machine Learning Reply Austria we work with our clients on leading-edge data science projects for which we are seeking Data Strategy Consultants with a strong economics and IT background to support on the bridge between strategy consulting and data science.

Machine Learning Reply, with its sister company in Italy and over 12.000 employees at Reply globally, is a fast-growing consultancy focused on solving problems with Data Science and the right organizational frameworks as their backbone. We offer tailor-made end-to-end solutions in the Data Sciencearea--both in the cloud and on-prem--thatcover the entire project lifecycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and infrastructure issues to data processing, modeling and visualization.

We are a tight knit, laid back, but seriously motivated unit that aims to be involved at conferences and in community of practices with our tech partners. We bring together what belongs together: Strategy consulting with Data... Science and Data Engineering.

Whether you are already experienced in strategic project management with a focus on enabling data driven business models or just graduated having gained first experience in big data technologies - If you never lose focus, are numbers driven, but with a passion for data-story-telling? Then we want to hear from you!

Depending on project scope and your interest, you may be working as a Strategy Consultant, Business Analyst or Project Manager / Product Owner.

Tasks:
• Develop Big Data Strategies with our clients based on their challenges
• Support C-Level decision making by providing business cases, qualitative assessments and workshops
• Leadan implementation project and communicate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers & Stakeholders
• Transform the business on an organizational level to be ready to become data-driven
• Analyze and adapt current business processes to make them fit for their purpose
• Formulate business needs and translate needs into technological requirements together with Data Scientists and Data Engineers
• Develop customer specific Use Cases and guide our client through the entire Use Case lifecycle from creative workshops to implementation
• Communicate and present results effectively and confidently to the clients in meetings and workshops with keen attention to detail and overall goal
• Advise the client on how data usage is shaping strategic decisions or how artificial intelligence can support the business by opening new fields of operations

What we offer you:
• We offer you for this position according to the collective agreement for employees in data processing and information technology a gross monthly salary of at least € 3215 (Consultant) or € 4286 (Senior Consultant) depending on your previous experience.
• Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
• Very active group social program - including conference funding, team building, group events, Reply Exchange
• Recognition for Innovation to foster your personal development
• Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network (more than 90 autonomous Reply groups across 8 countries)
• Office space in downtown Vienna with access to Stammstrecke
• Training and certification encouraged
• Home-office contracts
• State-of-the-art work equipment
• Public transport ticket within Vienna
• Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
• Flexible work environment between client, Reply office and remote work

Qualifications:
• Experienceand/orinterestin the area ofdriving artificial intelligence use casesas well as a good understanding of digitalization of AI & ML business models and their disruptive impact on corporations
• Master’s degreeand a strongquantitativebackground, for example in Business Informatics, Business Science (with an additional background in Informatics), Computer Science (with additional background in Economics)
• Ability to convincinglycommunicateresults touppermanagementlevel
• Fluent inEnglishandGerman(or a strong motivation to learn the language)
• Experience/interest in (agile) project management &cloud technologies

What are you waiting for?

Join our team atMachine Learning Replyas aData Strategy Consultant!

Über das Unternehmen:
Machine Learning Reply

title: (Senior) Data Consultant for Online Marketing (m/f/x)
description:
Job Description

With your ability to recognize complex data correlations and explain them in a comprehensible way, you consult and develop our teams and clients in data projects in the online marketing context. You know how to combine new and existing data sources, love to structure, and analyze large amounts of data, enjoy passing on your technical knowledge and actively contribute to the continuous development of data driven marketing.

What you will do:
• You develop existing and new data-driven services and products for our clients in the digital marketing area
• You actively contribute to the education and training of our digital consultants in the areas of data acquisition/storage/processing/visualisation/analysis/maintenance.
• You advise our clients on data-driven projects
• You ensure high data quality and derive data-based recommendations
• You keep an eye on industry trends and digital developments to incorporate them into your consulting services

Requirements

What we... expect:
• 3+ years professional experience in a data-focused role in the marketing field
• Experience with data integration and data modeling (Python) and with tools like Adverity, Segment, Tealium, Rapidminer etc. and with databases (SQL, Postgres)
• Experience with data visualization (Looker Studio, PowerBI, Tableau)
• An advantage is additional experience with web-analytics & tracking (HTML, JavaScript, Google Analytics) and digital/social media analytics (e.g. Meta platforms, LinkedIn, Pinterest, etc.)
• Know-How in operational marketing automation and data collection
• Strong consulting and conceptual skills in the area of communication
• Fluency in English
• Strong communication skills
• Independent, structured and goal-oriented way of working

Contact

Victoria Vargas-Grimm

+43 676 3094220

Your annual gross salary for this position (full time) is at least 37.800 € (Intermediate), 49,000 € (Senior). How much more is on your salary slip depends on your qualifications, experience and commitment

title: Senior Consultant* – Data Management
description:
Als globale Unternehmensberatung mit Fokus auf die Finanzdienstleistungsbranche kombinieren wir bei Capco innovatives Denken mit einzigartigem Know-How. So divers wie unsere Mitarbeiter*, sind auch unsere Lösungen, die wir unseren Kunden anbieten. Bringe Dich ein und setze Deine Ideen bei Capco in die Tat um als…

Senior Consultant* – Data Management

In Frankfurt am Main, Düsseldorf, München, Berlin oder Wien

Deine Capco Benefits

Du bist uns wichtig! Daher bekommst Du einen persönlichen Coach an Deine Seite gestellt, der Dich individuell fördert und unterstützt. Zudem bieten wir Dir ein umfangreiches Trainingsangebot sowie anerkannte Zertifizierungen. Mit unserer Start-Up-Mentalität und unseren flachen Hierarchien, stehen Dir alle Möglichkeiten offen. Nach Feierabend hast Du bei Teamevents oder gemeinsamen Aktivitäten die Chance, Dein Netzwerk zu erweitern und Deine Hobbies mit Kollegen* zu teilen.
• Capco Benefits Card mit monatlicher Gutschrift
• Bike Leasing Programm und... geförderte Gesundheitschecks
• Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm
• Flexible Arbeitsmodelle
• Unser Office Management in der City in FFM, direkt am Opernplatz, hält immer Erfrischungen und Überraschungen bereit

Deine Capco Aufgaben
• Du begleitest herausfordernde agile Beratungsprojekte hinsichtlich Aufbau, Entwicklung und Optimierung des Data Managements von der Business Analyse und Fachkonzeption bis hin zur fachlichen Umsetzung
• Dabei wendest Du moderne Verfahren und Technologien an, um ein hocheffizientes, transparentes und qualitativ hochwertiges Datenmanagement zu ermöglichen
• Du unterstützt unseren Kunden bei der Umsetzung der relevanten Data Management Aktivitäten für den Wechsel von einer prozessbasierten hin zu einer datenbasierten Organisationsstruktur
• Dieses beinhaltet insbesondere die Ausgestaltung der Data Governance Organisation, der Definition von Datenelementen, Data Lineage, Datenliefervereinbarungen und der Sicherstellung der Datenqualität
• Du übernimmst Verantwortung für Deine Themen sowie die Führung von Teilprojekten und Projektteams hinsichtlich Aufgaben des Data Management
• Neben der Projektarbeit hast Du die Möglichkeit, Dich in verschiedenen internen Themen mit einzubringen, diese zu entwickeln und eigene Ideen umzusetzen

Dein Capco Profil
• Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Ingenieurwesen oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs zeichnen Dich aus
• Du verfügst über mehrjährige relevante praktische Projekterfahrung in Bezug auf die notwendigen Vorgehensweisen und Methoden des Data Management bzw. BCBS 239
• Du hast Erfahrungen bei der Konzeption und Einführung von Datenmanagement Standards und Best Practices insbesondere hinsichtlich dem Aufbau einer Data Governance Organisation mit der Einführung von Data Management Tools (z. B. Collibra, Ab Initio), Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs, Durchführung der Data Lineage oder die Konzeption und Umsetzung eines Datenqualitätsmanagements
• Du bist teamfähig, besitzt sehr gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten sowie Durchsetzungsvermögen
• Deine fließenden Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sowie eine uneingeschränkte Mobilität im (inter-)nationalen Raum runden Dein Profil ab

Bewirb Dich jetzt! Dauert nur 5 Min. Versprochen!

Dein Capco Recruiter*

Aylin Han erreichst Du am besten unter: aylin.han@capco.com
• Wichtig ist nur, dass wir zueinander passen (m/w/d) #beyourselfatwork

title: Data Analyst/BI Consultant
description:
Firmenprofil

Unser Mandant ist ein modernes und länderübergreifendes Unternehmen aus dem Bereich Business Software Solutions und sucht Data Analysten mit Fokus auf Business Intelligence. Dabei tangiert das Unternehmen unterschiedliche Branchen als Kunden und bietet somit weitreichende Karrieremöglichkeiten sowie Einsatzbereiche. Darüber hinaus zeichnet sich das Unternehmen durch moderne Softwarelösungen und enormer Flexibilität aus.

Aufgabengebiet
• Erstellen Sie für Kunden individuelle BI-Lösungen mit Microsoft Data Platform & Analytics oder Qlik Sense/QlikView Applikationen
• Erhebung von Daten der Kunden für Analyse und Prognose ihrer Geschäftsprozesse
• Verarbeitung von Kundendaten zu Informationen und suche nach einer geeigneten Form um Insights zu visualisieren
• Selbstständige und eigenverantwortlich Umsetzung von Kundenprojekten
• Lösung von Issues der jeweiligen Kunden und Durchführung von Trainings

Anforderungsprofil
• Informationstechnische oder betriebswirtschaftliche... Ausbildung
• Mindestens 3 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung, selbstständige und verantwortungsbewusste Arbeitsweise
• Begeisterung für Zahlen, Daten, Analyse und Visualisierung
• Kenntnisse im Bereich Business Intelligence und Datenbanken (SQL)
• Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Microsoft PowerBI, AzureML, Python, AzureDataLake, Dynamics365 oder mit Qlik
• Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Vergütungspaket
• Attraktives Vergütungspaket
• Moderne Arbeitsbedingungen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
• Spannende, herausfordernde und länderübergreifende Projekte in unterschiedlichen Branchen
• Fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung inklusive Zertifizierungen
• Internationales Arbeitsumfeld
• Bei Erfüllung der geforderten Kriterien liegt das Jahresbruttogehalt für diese Position bei mind. 55.000 Euro auf Vollzeitbasis mit der Möglichkeit auf Überzahlung (bis zu 85.000 Euro

title: Senior Cloud Consultant with Focus on Data
description:
remote type

Hybrid

locations

Austria, Wien

Austria, Linz

Austria, Graz

time type

Full time

job requisition id

R111224

You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

About us in Austria

With more than 300 Tietoevry experts and offices in Vienna, Linz and Graz, Tietoevry Austria is committed to develop enterprises and society through IT by realizing new opportunities in customer’s business transformation. We believe in professional development and results by supporting our customers on their journey into a meaningful digital world.

Our development and consulting portfolio ranges from Cloud and Data Driven Solutions to Design & Experience to SAP services and Digital Advisory.

Due to our positive business development, we keep growing in Austria and are therefore looking for colleagues who share our values: thriving an... autonomous style of work, understanding learning as a lifestyle and seeking to make real, sustainable differences through digitalization for our customers in business and society.

With us you will be responsible for
• making sure our customers' data turns into actual assets
• working with customer stakeholders to build efficient and future-proof data logistics solutions
• guiding solution design with a team of highly motivated data professionals
• tasks like PoCs, architectural design sessions, implementation projects, IT portfolio transformation plans, deployment guidance as well as workshops
• helping our project managers, data specialists and cloud engineers to understand the customers' needs and create business impact with our solutions
• turning hyped topics (big data, IoT, AI, data mesh) into tangible results by helping our customers organization adapt to new ways of working
• helping our customer and sales teams to communicate the potential value of data and new solutions around it

We expect you to have
• experience in connecting business problems to solution designs
• strong expertise with handling business data, ideally in data platforms (preferably with Microsoft Azure, alternatively AWS or GCP)
• good understanding of connected areas like data modelling, ETL, data governance, meta data management, data security, business intelligence
• strong presentation and communication skills
• excellent verbal and written communication skills, with business-fluent English and German
• a passion for digital possibilities, organizations and for learning

As a person you are
• proactive and act with open mind by challenging the status quo and drive actions for change
• taking ownership of your results and delivered quality and passionately drive execution to add customer value
• having fun at work, love to learn new things and work within a dynamic team
• willing to research topics you may need and don’t know about yet

We offer
• an exciting career path with a wide variety of personal and professional development opportunities
• a large customer network and an industrialized consulting solution portfolio
• a great opportunity to take part in the development of our company together with talented colleagues and inspiring international environment
• excellent teamwork which is a part of our values and the possibility to share your competences with your colleagues
• benefits like flexible working hours, home office, laptop and smartphone also for private use, health programs, team events, excellent public transport connection, food vouchers, fresh fruits, the perfect environment to prosper professionally etc.
• a salary of minimum EUR 4.032,00. The actual salary depends on your experience and qualification

Further information

If you are interested to work for a highly customer focused company together with an ambitious team, you are warmly welcome to send in your application.

Part time applications encouraged.

Catharina Christian, Recruitment Specialist, Tietoevry Austria

title: Lead Data Analyst
description:
About The Role

As a company founded by service-disabled Veterans, we at DFC are driven by a duty to serve our clients, our employees, and our community. We are committed to helping organizations achieve their goals by cultivating a team of talented professionals that deliver exceptional service, creative insights, and high-quality results.

DFC seeks an experienced Lead Data Analyst to support a project supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA). The project will support VBA's enterprise-level human capital ideation initiatives and customer experience portfolio and provide project management support, event management and execution, and business process engineering. This position focuses on providing vision and leadership to design, develop, and deliver modern analytics tools, statistical analysis and data analytic services, data management services.

What The Role Requires
• Serve as an expert advisor and resource on data analytics... including analysis and visual communication of big data sets, in order to develop, implement, lead, and direct data management strategies that provide technical direction of data management capability areas.
• Be responsible for understanding large data sets and leading and managing advance data techniques in support of emerging initiatives and projects.
• Lead and report on data analysis efforts using a variety of tailored analytical techniques,
• Review and present results to senior management and other end-users,
• Collect, analyze, and report on data from various sources and systems,
• Develop and implement a wide range of advanced qualitative and quantitative methods to assess and improve operational effectiveness,
• Create and run SQL queries against data from a variety of sources,
• Support development of data reports, including dashboards, data visualizations,
• Lead data mining efforts on internal government and external public sources,
• Provide viable reference material for users by writing and maintaining user documentation,
• Maintain client confidence and protect operations by maintaining information confidentiality,
• Work toward professional improvement and certifications, maintains current certifications, develops and maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops.

What You Need To Be Successful
• At least 5 years of experience in data analysis
• Comprehensive knowledge and experience with operating enterprise level advanced analytical services, enterprise performance measures, and data management operations
• Comprehensive knowledge of industry leading advanced data analytics technology for large and complex organizations
• Ability to work well in team-based environment.
• Ability to work independently and develop client relationships.
• Ability to lead and facilitate client meetings, conference calls, and capture accurate meeting notes.
• Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
• Well-organized with the ability to handle several projects/clients simultaneously.
• Strong analytical skills, presentation development and writing skills.
• Exceptional skills in Microsoft Office Suite, including Microsoft Excel
• Experience with statistical software such as SPSS or SAS
• Strong work ethic with a commitment to client service excellence
• Strong client presence
• Experience working with federal government projects is strongly preferred.

Other Important Information
• Master's degree in mathematics, statistics, science, operational research, or a related field is required
• Ability to obtain a US government security clearance, if needed, is required.
• Applicants must have the legal right to work in the US for any employer; sponsorship is not available for this position.
• Preference will be given to qualified Veteran candidates.

Is consulting the right career for you?

A career in consulting can offer a wide variety of experiences and is a great opportunity for personal and professional growth, but it often requires a bit more time and energy than the standard nine-to-five. The characteristics below are those of a typical consultant in this field; we encourage you to consider if these are applicable to you as you complete your application.
• Thrives when working in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
• Balances competing priorities and fluctuating workloads with composure.
• Works well in teams or independently, as the job requires.
• Commits the requisite hours and effort to ensure deliverables are submitted on time and error-free.
• Dives into new and unfamiliar tasks, employing a learn-as-you-go mentality and problem-solving skills.
• Has the foresight to strategically plan and anticipate next steps and outcomes?
• Uses interpersonal skills to establish and uphold strong client relationships, representing the company positively.
• Values quality in client deliverables and internal tasks
• Enjoys having a high level of responsibility and task autonomy.
• Acts professionally in all circumstances and enjoys creating and nurturing a professional network of peers, clients, and partners.

title: Data & Insights Consultant for Procurement / Supply Chain...
description:
Data & Insights Consultant for Procurement / Supply Chain Management (m/f/d).

IN Cologne, Vienna.

We are one of the best consultancies for strategic procurement and supply chain management. As an independent subsidiary of BCG, we offer the best of both worlds: in-depth expertise and high strategic competence and we are able to draw on a strong, international infrastructure, which makes us even more dynamic in the market.

That's why we want to strengthen our team. With someone that matches our ambitions as well as our spirit. So that we remain not only very successful, but also very INVERTO.

VERY EXCITING FOR YOU.

Support.

You'll be the interface between project work and data analysis, supporting project teams as well as customers in every aspect of data processing, analysis and visualization.

Agile project work.

Taking customer and project requirements into account, you'll be responsible for solving complex issues with the help of data-supported evaluations and clear... visualizations. You'll support and advise the project team and provide fascinating insights into procurement and supply chain management in a range of industries.

Diverse challenges.

As an expert in data analytics, as well as project work, your role will include sharing your knowledge with your colleagues, and also developing and implementing your own products and solutions, to ensure our services for INVERTO's customers continue to expand.

VERY IMPORTANT FOR US.

You'll have a degree in economics, informatics or engineering and may already have some practical experience, ideally focusing on data and analytics.

You'll love drawing exciting insights from existing customer data which can contribute towards your solutions and a project's success.

Processing larger data sets and data models is something you enjoy, as well as spending time working with tools such as Power Query and Power BI.

You'll be interested in developing your skills in other programs, such as Microsoft Power Platforms or MS Azure, and also learning about Python.

You'll be able to demonstrate excellent business communication skills in both German and English.

Very INVERTO: Team spirit. Feet on the ground. Fairness. Fun

title: (Junior) Consultant Data Science & AI (m/w/d)
description:
• For the further expansion of our AI team within the Insights & Data Practice, we are looking for a (Junior) Consultant Data Science & AI (m/f/d) for our location in Vienna.

Your tasks
• Delivery and support for Data Science & AI projects
• Preparation of requirements analysis and collection of data
• Creation of custom machine learning models based on open source tools

your profile
• Completed studies in mathematics, statistics, data science, computer science or a similar subject
• First (hands-on) experience in the field of machine learning and data science
• Very good knowledge of Python and/or R
• Very good knowledge of German and English
• Ability to work in a team and convincing communication skills
• Excellent analytical skills and a proactive way of working
• Openness to possible international project assignments

The following skills would be beneficial
• Experience with AI in the cloud, preferably Azure (AWS, Google Cloud)
• Experience in digital manufacturing or in the... production sector
• Experience in IoT and Industry 4.0
• Basic knowledge of Big Data, data analysis and data storage systems (SQL/NoSQL Database, Data Lake)
• Knowledge of using BI and data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau)

benefits
• Internationality: an interesting and diverse working environment at the largest IT consultancy of European origin, as well as a wide range of career opportunities through working within an international group, which is represented in over 40 countries and whose employees themselves come from over 100 countries
• Responsibility: working independently – creativity and innovation are very important to us
• Flexibility: flexible time management and location-independent work to optimize the work-life balance
• Further development: Your further development is important to us and we have learning platforms, exchange with global experts and international communities, as well as strong technology partners at your disposal. Training and certifications are also part of your personal development
• Team spirit: we are looking for team players who can identify with our values ??and fit into our young and dynamic team
• Events: we offer numerous team and company events as well as numerous attractive employee offers
• Our company is subject to the “collective agreement for employees in information and consulting”. An annual target salary of between EUR 42,000 and EUR 55,000 gross is offered with overpayment in line with the market, depending on qualifications and experience.
• We look forward to receiving your application in English

title: Senior Cloud Consultant with Focus on Data
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

About us in Austria

With more than 300 Tietoevry experts and offices in Vienna, Linz and Graz, Tietoevry Austria is committed to develop enterprises and society through IT by realizing new opportunities in customer’s business transformation.

We believe in professional development and results by supporting our customers on their journey into a meaningful digital world.

Our development and consulting portfolio ranges from Cloud and Data Driven Solutions to Design & Experience to SAP services and Digital Advisory.

Due to our positive business development, we keep growing in Austria and are therefore looking for colleagues who share our values : thriving an autonomous style of work, understanding learning as a lifestyle and seeking to make real, sustainable differences through... digitalization for our customers in business and society.

With us you will be responsible for

making sure our customers' data turns into actual assets

working with customer stakeholders to build efficient and future-proof data logistics solutions

guiding solution design with a team of highly motivated data professionals

tasks like PoCs , architectural design sessions, implementation projects, IT portfolio transformation plans, deployment guidance as well as workshops

helping our project managers, data specialists and cloud engineers to understand the customers' needs and create business impact with our solutions

turning hyped topics (big data, IoT, AI, data mesh) into tangible results by helping our customers organization adapt to new ways of working

helping our customer and sales teams to communicate the potential value of data and new solutions around it

We expect you to have

experience in connecting business problems to solution designs

strong expertise with handling business data, ideally in data platforms (preferably with Microsoft Azure, alternatively AWS or GCP)

good understanding of connected areas like data modelling, ETL, data governance, meta data management, data security, business intelligence

strong presentation and communication skills

excellent verbal and written communication skills, with business-fluent English and German

a passion for digital possibilities, organizations and for learning

As a person you are

proactive and act with open mind by challenging the status quo and drive actions for change

taking ownership of your results and delivered quality and passionately drive execution to add customer value

having fun at work, love to learn new things and work within a dynamic team

willing to research topics you may need and don’t know about yet

We offer

an exciting career path with a wide variety of personal and professional development opportunities

a large customer network and an industrialized consulting solution portfolio

a great opportunity to take part in the development of our company together with talented colleagues and inspiring international environment

excellent teamwork which is a part of our values and the possibility to share your competences with your colleagues

benefits like flexible working hours, home office, laptop and smartphone also for private use, health programs, team events, excellent public transport connection, food vouchers, fresh fruits, the perfect environment to prosper professionally etc.

a salary of minimum EUR ,00. The actual salary depends on your experience and qualification

Further information

If you are interested to work for a highly customer focused company together with an ambitious team, you are warmly welcome to send in your application.

Part time applications encouraged.

Catharina Christian, Recruitment Specialist, Tietoevry Austria

title: Capgemini Invent: Data Analyst Consultant (m/w/d) – Dein Einstieg...
description:
Be part of our journey

Du bist auf der Suche nach spannenden Innovations-, Design- und Transformationsprojekten? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Capgemini Invent ist eine international tätige Strategieberatung der Capgemini Gruppe mit über 13.000 Mitarbeiter:innen an mehr als 36 Standorten weltweit. Gemeinsam mit dir unterstützen wir unsere Kund:innen dabei, ihre unternehmerische Zukunft zu gestalten und nachhaltige Geschäftsmodelle zu entwickeln. Du willst auch deine eigene Zukunft gestalten und dich persönlich weiterentwickeln? Dann nutze jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unserer gemeinsamen Reise!

Get the future you want

Erfolgreiche Transformationen basieren auf Daten. Wir sorgen für eine datengesteuerte Entscheidungsfindung im gesamten Unternehmen. Mit einer soliden Datenstrategie, moderner Analytik und KI sowie Einblicken in Echtzeit können unsere Kund:innen präzise planen, messen, verbessern und transformieren.

Klingt das interessant? Dann ist das Team Enterprise Data ... Analytics das Richtige für dich!

What you should bring to our journey
• Einen herausragenden Studienabschluss (Bachelor/ Master) aller Fachrichtungen
• Erste Erfahrungen in der Datenaufbereitung und Datenmodellierung
• Spaß an der Kombination von Innovation, strategischer Analyse und Umsetzungsarbeit, sowie das Talent, konzeptionell und analytisch zu denken
• Hohe Zuverlässigkeit, Teamgeist und Fit für eine weltweit führende Managementberatung
• Interesse und ggf. erste Erfahrungen im Präsentieren oder Moderieren von Workshops
• Exzellente Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sowie sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse

Your experience at Capgemini Invent

Du arbeitest an innovativen Strategieprojekten mit digitalen Zukunftsthemen und das in internationalen Teams.

Du erfährst Zusammenarbeit mit dem Top-Management mittelständischer Unternehmen, sowie börsennotierter Konzerne jeder Industrie.

Du hast transparente Karriereperspektiven, sowie viel Raum für Eigeninitiative.

Du bekommst dein individuelles Trainingsportfolio, sowie herausragende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb eines weltweiten Expertennetzwerks.

Du genießt flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home Office Möglichkeiten.

Du profitierst von langjährig gelebter und auf Werte ausgerichteter Unternehmenskultur.

Wir freuen uns über deine vollständige Bewerbung (Motivationsschreiben, aussagekräftiger Lebenslauf, relevante Zeugnisse) ausschließlich über unser Bewerbungsportal.

Es gilt der Kollektivvertrag für Angestellte (m/w/d) in Information und Consulting. Je nach Studienabschluss bieten wir ein Mindestgehalt von 55.000 EUR brutto im Jahr. Das erscheint dir wenig? Wir legen großen Wert darauf, dass dein Gehalt in einem angemessenen Verhältnis zu deinen Fähigkeiten und deinem Wert für unser Unternehmen steht. Daher berücksichtigen wir bei der Festlegung deines Gehalts sorgfältig deine Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen, um eine marktgerechte Überzahlung zu ermöglichen.

Bei Fragen wende dich bitte an unsere Spezialistin Anna Barcichowska vom Talent Recruiting (anna.barcichowska@capgemini.com

description:
Senior SAP DATA Migration Lead - Countrywide

If you are an experienced Senior SAP DATA migration expert, considering taking on a new career challenge?

This is a great new opportunity to work for a well-known consulting firm, and support international customers in Germany with their SAP / IT Digitalisation roadmaps.

Your Team

The teams are spread in multiple locations throughout Germany, and you will work closely with clients and support agile teams.

On offer

• Team-oriented corporate culture and communication
• Trust-based working hours, mobile working, and home office options
• Targeted career development
• International development opportunities and networks
• In-house training academy with a wide range of technical training, soft skills training, SAP Learning Hub, and certification opportunities

Please note you must speak a very good level of German and English to be considered for this position.

If you would like to see the full job description or have a confidential discussion, please do not hesitate to contact Archie Iqbal -Cloud International

title: Client Technical Sales Consultant, Data and AI Apps (f/m/x)
description:
Introduction

Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities

We are seeking a Data & AI Technical Specialist with a great attitude and willing to do what it takes to assist in building the most innovative analytical solutions. You will be a part of a team that will solve the most complex use cases with cutting edge solutions in he most Austrian market including telecommunications-, industrial sector, public sector and financial services... industry clients.

You will need to identify and understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements, competitive landscape, and recommend a solution which meet customer needs and solve enterprise challenges. In this role you will be expected to demonstrate and show off IBMs solutions so that customer can see the benefits of various Data & AI solutions within the context of their business.

Additionally, you will have the full resources of the entire IBM organization to continually grow your network and technical skills to be a leader in this field. Candidates will serve as technical liaisons with prospective and existing clients to provide industry and domain expertise to establish credibility for IBM's abilities and value proposition. Hands-on expertise with IBM Business Analytics tools and techniques is expected, including a business-level understanding of how AI and analytics can deliver business value.
• You are required to support customers current use cases and identify new opportunities based on customer needs. You will need to assist customers in navigating complex data and delivering analytics solutions that deliver business insights to achieve goals.You will be a key technical resource showing customers the value and power of IBM Software and solutions by demonstrating and talking through their complex use cases and environments. You will also help to identify new areas of a customer business that IBM software could be used for competitive advantage. You will also work very closely with sales, internal teams and business partners to help customers best achieve its goals.
• Use your experience and training to be a thought leader to help accelerate customers digital transformation while developing trust and credibility with integrity. You will be required to show our competitive advantage verse other solutions to ultimately drive their decision-making process. You will need to show the benefits of IBM Software by delivering effective demonstrations, Proof of Concept (PoC), Proof of Technology (PoT) and/or supporting critical situations. You will need to address specific concerns and share best practices that can be applied to their business.
• You are required to be knowledgeable on IBM products, solutions, services, and competitors within Data and AI but also our other solutions. You will be continually training on the newest technologies to drive digital transformation and insights for our customers. These technologies include AI, data science, data fabric and Red Hat OpenShift just to name a few.

Minimum Reference Salary based on Austrian Market Ranges: EUR 35.700,-. Possibility for over-payment is based on education and experience.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
• Ability to clearly articulate complex technical solutions into business-friendly language by showing the solutions and explaining the business value.
• Ability to understand technical and business requirements to determining the best solution to fit the needs of the customer.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
• Understand and demonstrate IBM Data and AI solutions to show business value and understand our competitive differentiation within the market.
• Technical Sales Preferred or relevant analytics solutions experience.
• Experience with using and implementing Business Analytics, Planning & Forecasting Solutions (such as: Cognos Analytics, Tableau, PowerBI, Planning Analytics, SAP, Anaplan, Hyperion).
• Experience with AI/ML solutions and/or Watson (or other AI competitors - Open Source, AWS, Microsoft, Google).
• Experience with using and implementing Data Science/Machine Learning solutions (Watson Studio, SPSS, Open Source, Microsoft Cognitive Services, AWS Sagemaker).
• Collaborate with sales to effectively develop your territory which will include opportunity identification, customer satisfaction, use case development and working with business partners to drive the sales and adoption of IBM Software.
• Certifications - Red Hat Open Shift, IBM Developer or Data Science certifications.

About Business Unit

IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status

title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description

At

Machine Learning Reply Austria we strive to work on leading-edge data science projects with our clients for which we are seeking Cloud Engineer consultants with a strong technical background.

Machine Learning Reply, with its sister companies in Italy and Germany and over 8500 employees at Reply globally, is a fast-growing consultancy focused on solving problems with Data Science, Cloud technologies and the right organizational frameworks as their backbone. We are a tight knit, laid back, but seriously motivated unit that aims to be involved at conferences and in community of practice with our tech partners.

We offer tailor-made end-to-end cloud-based solutions in the Data Science area that cover the entire project life cycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and infrastructure issues to data processing and deployment of production-ready algorithms.

We have a vast expertise in every step of the Data Science implementation spectrum in all... key industries of the German HDAX-companies. With focus on open source and cloud technologies we enable our customers to successfully introduce and implement new data-driven solutions and to optimize already existing processes and products while simultaneously adapting to cloud technologies.

Tasks

Use your cloud know-how and work closely with our customers to find out what the perfect (cloud) technology is for them!
• Through your knowledge you are able to design innovative, technical approaches for cloud solution architectures
• Your designed cloud architectures (based on AWS, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud) will be implemented by you also always considering DevOps / MLOps
• You will not be alone and will work closely with colleagues from Data Science or Data Engineering to jointly develop data-intensive applicationssuch as data warehouses, data lakes and/or data platforms
• You enjoy brainstorming, conceptualization and final implementation. You therefore like to accompany the complete LifeCycle by creating specifications, code and presentations for your solutions.
• As part of the Reply network, you join communities of practice, participate in hackathons and use all available learning resources

What we offer you:
• We offer you for this position according to the collective agreement for employees in data processing and information technology a gross monthly salary of at least EUR 3215 (Consultant) or EUR 4286 (Senior Consultant) depending on your previous experience.
• Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
• Very active group social program - including conference funding, team building, group events, Reply Exchange
• Recognition for Innovation to foster your personal development
• Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network (more than 90 autonomous Reply groups across 8 countries)
• Office space in downtown Vienna with access to Stammstrecke
• Training and certification encouraged
• Home-office contracts
• State of the art work equipment
• Award winning office spaces for an excellent work experience
• Public transport ticket within Vienna
• Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
• Flexible work environment between client, Reply office and remote work

Requirements

A university degree in (business) informatics, mathematics, statistics (or comparable) and at least 3 years of professional experience in industry or consulting
• Experience in the development of data-intensive applications such as data warehouses, data lakes and / or data platforms
• You have knowledge in code development using Java/Scala or Python
• You are familiar with relational databases as well as ideally NoSQL databases (e.g. Oracle, Aurora, Mongodb, Cassandra)
• Deep understanding in the development of Machine Learning applications as well as solutions based on Big Data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark or their cloud-based equivalents
• Very good English and good German skills as well as willingness to travel nationally

Unterstützen Sie ab sofort am StandortWien oder Linz unseren stark expandierenden Geschäftsbereich Management Consulting – IT Advisory mit Know-how, Engagement, Lernbereitschaft und Teamgeist!

• Herausfordernde und abwechslungsreiche Projekte für führende nationale und internationale Unternehmen
• Verantwortungsvolle und vielseitige Tätigkeiten innerhalb eines jungen und motivierten Teams
• Spaß an der Arbeit im Kreise begeisterter Kolleg:nnen und ein angenehmes Arbeitsklima
• Mentorship-Programm, gezielte Aus- und Weiterbildung(Konferenzen, Zertifizierungen, Schulungen)
• Zahlreiche Benefits & Social Events
• Ausdifferenzierte Karrieremodelle mit spannenden Entwicklungs- und Spezialisierungsmöglichkeiten
• Sicherheit eines Großkonzerns, gestalterische Freiheiten eines Start-Ups
• Home-Office Möglichkeit

title: Experienced Data Strategy Consultant (all genders)
description:
Data & AI

Als Data Consultant in Zühlkes AI + Data Practice schlägst Du die Brücke zwischen AI-Technologien und dem Business – und wirst so zum «Trusted Advisor» für Entscheidungspersonen bei unseren Kunden in AI-Projekten.

Deine Aufgabe
• Du entwickelst die richtigen Strategien für unternehmerische Vorhaben im Bereich AI und Daten und unterstützt unsere Kunden bei ihrer Transformation zum datengetriebenen Unternehmen in verschiedenen Dimensionen.
• Du verstehst AI- und Daten-Technologien als Werkzeuge, um faktenbasierte Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen, Prozesse zu optimieren oder neue Produkte und Dienstleistungen zu entwickeln. Damit erkennst Du bei unseren Kunden Potenziale, um mit diesen Werkzeugen echten Wert für ihr Business zu generieren.
• Du planst, organisierst und leitest Workshops und verwendest Beratungsmethoden zur Unterstützung unserer Kunden.
• In AI-Projekten und Programmen setzt Du Zühlkes holistischen Ansatz um, indem Du alle relevanten Ebenen und Disziplinen wie... beispielsweise Datenplattformen, Data Governance, Algorithmik und Anwendungsfälle berücksichtigst und die Zusammenarbeit von entsprechenden Experten moderierst. Damit stellst Du den Projekterfolg und die Wertgenerierung sicher.
• Du kommunizierst gut und gerne mit Entscheidern bei unseren Kunden – und es macht Dir Spaß, unser AI-Offering zu positionieren und damit unser AI-Geschäft aktiv noch weiter zu entwickeln.
• Du bist als Botschafter unserer Disziplin AI in- und extern aktiv und entwickelst unsere Offerings und unsere Expertise weiter.
• Du positionierst Dich als «Thought Leader» für Dein Spezialgebiet im Bereich AI und hilfst, junge Talente zu entwickeln.

Dein Profil
• Du verfügst über ein Hochschulstudium im Bereich Business Management o. ä. mit einer Zusatzausbildung im Bereich AI oder über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes technisches Hochschulstudium in Computer Science oder Engineering.
• Erfahrung in Leitung von Beratungsprojekten.
• Expertise im Bereich Data Strategy, Data Governance, Data Management, Data Organization.
• Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von digitalen Produkten und Dienstleistungen wäre ideal.
• Beherrschung von Methoden der Innovationsberatung (Lean Start-Up, Design Thinking), der Prozessberatung, der agilen Business-Analyse bzw. des agilen Arbeitens (Scrum, Kanban).
• Überzeugende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Dein Profil ab.

Deine Persönlichkeit
• Du bist eine durchsetzungsfähige, eloquente und proaktive Persönlichkeit, die in der Lage ist, selbständig und eigenverantwortlich zu agieren.
• Du bringst hohe Kundenorientierung mit und besitzt die Fähigkeit, interdisziplinär zu denken und zu kommunizieren.
• Ebenso bist Du ergebnisorientiert und kannst Stakeholder und Entscheider für sich gewinnen.

Unsere Arbeitsphilosophie

Bei Zühlke fördern wir ein Growth Mindset und unterstützen den Erfolg unserer Mitarbeitenden. Wir tauschen regelmäßig Ideen aus, geben einander Feedback und lernen voneinander. Dabei le-gen wir Wert auf eine offene und klare Kommunikation miteinander. Wir gehen mit Hindernissen und Misserfolgen eigeninitiativ um, haben eine optimistische Grundhaltung und ergreifen Maßnahmen zur langfristigen Sicherung der Leistungsfähigkeit. Veränderungen begegnen wir agil, aktiv und offen, denn aus jeder Herausforderung können wir etwas lernen.

Unser Angebot
• Toller Arbeitsplatz: Wir bieten eine Kultur des Vertrauens, ermutigen unsere Mitarbeitenden, über den Tellerrand zu schauen und ihre Ideen zu teilen.
• Wir unterstützen Dich bei Deiner Entwicklung: Wir engagieren uns für das Wachstum unserer Mitarbeiter und investieren in ihre Entwicklung. Wir befähigen sie, sich die Fähigkeiten anzueignen, die sie brauchen, um heute und in Zukunft sowohl persönlich als auch für unsere Kunden einen positiven Beitrag zu leisten.
• Work-Life Balance: Wir bieten Dir eine familienfreundliche Arbeitsumgebung, flexible Arbeitszeiten ohne Kernzeiten und Homeoffice.
• Erfolgsbeteiligung: Zusätzlich zum Jahresgehalt erhältst Du eine Erfolgsbeteiligung, bestimmt durch das Geschäftsergebnis des Vorjahres.
• Weitere Benefits: Team- und Social Events, jährliches Team Camp, Jahreskarte Wiener Linien, Einkaufszuschuss, ein topmoderner Arbeitsplatz (offenes Büro, High-End Notebooks)

Für diese Position bieten wir ein attraktives Gehaltspaket mit deutlicher Überzahlung zum IT-KV (ST2/Regelstufe). Das vorgesehene Bruttomonatsgehalt beginnt bei EUR 4.200,- und richtet sich letztendlich nach Deiner Qualifikation und Erfahrung.

Dann gestalte Deine Zukunft noch heute und bewirb Dich bei Zühlke!

description:
Festanstellung • Wien
Consultant Data Analytics (w/m/d)
Über PROMATIS software GmbH:
Wir bieten unternehmensstrategische und betriebswirtschaftliche Beratung und kombinieren diese mit IT-Konzeptionen bis hin zu umsetzungsorientiertem Projektmanagement. Kennzeichen unserer Arbeit sind Vertrauen, unternehmerisches Denken und eine ausgeprägte Methodenkompetenz. Nicht theoretische Konzepte sind unser Ziel, sondern machbare Lösungen mit optimalem Return-on-Investment!

Unsere Vision ist eine erfolgreiche Organisation mit lernenden Geschäftsprozessen und Informationssystemen, die eine optimale Entfaltung der Potenziale des Faktors Mensch ermöglichen.

Klingt spannend? Dann freuen wir uns auf eine aussagekräftige Bewerbung über unseren Partner Workwise.
Was erwartet Dich?
• Dein Fokus liegt auf den Wissensbedarfen des Kunden, die sich je nach Anwendung an seinen betriebswirtschaftlichen oder technisch/wissenschaftlichen Zielen ausrichten. Daneben verschaffst du dir im Datenprofiling Klarheit... über das vorhandene Datenangebot.
• In konzeptuellen Datenmodellen sorgst Du für die fachliche Strukturierung der Daten. Für die anschließende Realisierung mit Oracle Datenbanktechnologien greifst Du auf relationale, multidimensionale, hybride und für Big Data auch NoSQL-Datenschemata zurück.
• Für die Datenhaltung nutzt Du Oracle Datenbanken, Data Warehouses und Data Marts on premises und zunehmend autonomous in der Cloud. Performance Management-Applikationen werden auf Basis von Oracle Essbase realisiert. Bei Bedarf greifst Du auch auf Open Source-Produkte zurück.
• Das Design der Reporting- und Analyseapplikationen und der Dashboards erfolgt in enger Abstimmung mit dem Kunden. Für die Realisierung kommt die ganze Palette der Oracle Analytics-Produkte, beim Kunden verfügbare Wettbewerber-Tools sowie Open Source-Produkte zum Einsatz.
• Bei der Datenmigration unterstützt Du im Datenprofiling, in der Konzeption der Datenübernahme (ETL – Extraktion, Transformation, Laden) und in der Realisierung des ETL-Prozesses einschließlich der erforderlichen Automatisierung und der Bereitstellung geeigneter Prüfroutinen.
Was solltest Du mitbringen?
• Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informationswirtschaft oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen mit IT-Affinität
• Erforderliche Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung– idealerweise im Oracle-Umfeld:
– Konzeption und Design: Data Profiling, Informationsbedarfsanalyse, Datenmodellierung, Design von Data Warehouses und Data Marts
– Datenmodellierung für Data Warehousing und OLAP: Star Schema, Snowflake Schema, Data Vault
– ETL: Konzeption, Entwicklung und Test von ETL-Prozessen
– Monitoring und Online-Analyse: Konzeption und Entwicklung von Berichten, Dashboards, Meldesystemen im Web und auf mobilen Endgeräten
– Physisches Design, Implementierung und Tuning von Business Intelligence-Datenbanken und
–Applikationen wahlweise in folgenden Technologien:
– Objektrelational, In-Memory – Multidimensional, Essbase – Big Data (NoSQL, Hadoop + Spark Frameworks)
• Interessante Zusatzqualifikationen:– Moderne Datenvisualisierungsmethoden und –technologien
– Oracle ETL und Real-Time-Integration: Data Integrator, Golden Gate, Streams
– Oracle Analytics Cloud
– Oracle Fusion Analytics
– Oracle Enterprise Performance Management Cloud
– Advanced Analytics: Data Mining, R Statistical Computing, Predictive Analytics
– Information Discovery: Oracle Endeca
• Verantwortungsbewusster Einsatz digitaler Technologien und der AI mit dem Ziel der Schaffung nachhaltiger humaner Anwendererlebnisse
• Kommunikationsfähigkeit, Abstraktions- und Strukturierungsvermögen, Sorgfalt in der Erstellung von Dokumentationen sowie gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
• Mobilität in der Projektarbeit im In- und Ausland
Was bieten wir Dir?
• Fortschrittliche Arbeitsmethoden und innovative Softwarewerkzeuge
• Arbeiten für den durch Oracle prämierten „Cloud Applications-Europameister“
• Einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz in einem wachstumsorientierten Unternehmen
• Flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell
• Individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
• Möglichkeit, gemeinsam ein positives, angenehmes Arbeitsklima in motivierten Teams zu gestalten
• Management mit flachen Hierarchien
• Nähe zu führenden Lehr- und Forschungsinstitutionen
• Erfahrung und Bereitschaft zur Einarbeitung von Berufs-, Quer- und Wiedereinsteigern
• Für diese Position bieten wir ein Mindestgehalt von 35.000 EUR brutto pro Jahr, abhängig von Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung, sowie gegebenenfalls die Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung

title: Experienced Data Strategy Consultant (all genders)
description:
Data & AI

As a Data Consultant in Zühlke's AI + Data Practice you will build the bridge between AI technologies and the business - and thus become a Trusted Advisor for decision makers at our customers in AI projects.

Your role
• You develop the right business strategies for AI + Data endeavors and you support our clients with their data-driven company transformation in various dimensions.
• You view AI + Data technologies as tools to enable fact-based decisions, optimize processes or develop new products and services. With this mindset, you recognize the potential of our customers businesses to generate real value with these tools.
• You plan, organize and lead workshops and use consulting methodologies to support our clients.
• In AI projects and programmes, you implement Zühlke's holistic approach by considering all relevant levels and disciplines such as data platforms, data governance, algorithms and use cases and by moderating the collaboration of relevant experts. This... ensures the success of the project and the generation of business value.
• You enjoy communicating with decision-makers at our customers - and you like positioning our AI offering and thus actively developing our AI business.
• You are active both internally and externally as an ambassador for our discipline AI and further develop our offerings and our expertise.
• You will position yourself as a thought leader for your special field in AI and help to develop young talent.

Your profile
• You have a university degree in business management or similar with additional training in AI or a successfully completed technical university degree in computer science or engineering
• Experience in leading consulting projects
• Expertise in data strategy, data governance, data management, data organization
• Experience in the development of digital products and services would be ideal
• Proficiency in innovation consulting methods (Lean Start-Up, Design Thinking), process consulting, agile business analysis or agile working (Scrum, Kanban)
• Convincing communication skills as well as very good German and English skills complete your profile

Your personality
• You are asserted, eloquent, and proactive and can act independently
• You are highly customer-oriented and have the ability to think and communicate in an interdisciplinary manner
• You are also results-oriented and able to win over stakeholders and decision-makers

Our work philosophy

title: Distributed Systems Engineer & Consultant (m/f/d)
description:
Responsibilities
• As Apache Kafka Consultant with profound distributed systems experience, you will be responsible for the administration and deployment of customized and advanced event streaming platforms based on Apache Kafka, current industry standards and using the latest tools and methods.
• You are in contact with your customer and are responsible for the preparation, planning, migration, control, monitoring and implementation of highly scalable event streaming platforms or Kafka projects and for comprehensive customer consulting on the current state of these technologies.
• As a Consultant for Big Data Management and Stream Processing, your goal is to implement the design and architectures for streaming platforms and stream processing use cases using open source and cloud tools.

Qualifications
• Completed studies or comparable training with a technical background
• Sound experience and knowledge in Java
• Experience with Apache Kafka or similar large-scale enterprise... distributed data systems technologies e.g. Kafka, Spark, CockroachDB, HDFS, Hive, etc.
• Experience in software development and automation to run big data systems
• Experience with implementing complex solutions for Big Data and Data Analytics applications
• Knowledge in system deployment and container technology with building, managing, deploying and release managing Docker containers and container images based on Docker, OpenShift and / or Kubernetes
• Knowledge in developing resilient scalable distributed systems and microservices architecture
• Experience with at least one of the distributed technologies (e.g. Kafka , Spark, CockroachDB, HDFS, Hive, etc.)
• Experience with at least one of the stream processing frameworks (e.g. Kafka Streams , Spark Streaming, Flink, Storm)
• Knowledge in Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CI / CD) using Jenkins, Maven, Automake, Make, Grunt, Rake, Ant, GIT, Subversion, Artefactory and Nexus.
• Understanding of SDLC processes (Agile, DevOps), Cloud Operations and Support (ITIL) Service Delivery
• Knowledge in authentication mechanism with OAuth, knowledge of Vert.x and Spring Boot
• Knowledge in SQL Azure , AWS development and cloud migration to one of AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform and / or Hybrid / Private Cloud;

as well as cloud-native end-to-end solutions, especially their key building blocks, workload types, migration patterns and tools
• Experience with monitoring tools and logging systems such as NewRelic, ELK, Splunk, Prometheus and Graylag
• Ability to communicate technical ideas in a business-friendly language
• Interest in modern organizational structure and an agile working environment (SCRUM)
• Customer-oriented and enjoy working in an international environment in German and English

With us you will be responsible for
• making sure our customers' data turns into actual assets
• working with customer stakeholders to build efficient and future-proof data logistics solutions

• tasks like PoCs, architectural design sessions, implementation projects, IT portfolio transformation plans, deployment guidance as well as workshops
